original: snga ma ji ltar snang bar te //
analyzed: snga ma ji ltar snang bar te //
translated: The former is as it appears,

original: phyi ma dam pa'i don du yin //
analyzed: phyi ma dam pa'i don du yin //
translated: The latter is in the ultimate sense.

original: de ltar yang dag don shes pa //
analyzed: de ltar yang dag don shes pa //
translated: Thus, knowing the reality of the two

original: khong du chud phyir lnga par bzhed //
analyzed: khong du chud phyir lnga par bzhed //
translated: Is accepted as the fifth, because of understanding.

original: las dang rnam par smin pa dag ni ji ltar snang ba bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las dang rnam par smin pa dag ni ji ltar snang ba bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Karma and its result are as they appear.

original: las dang rnam par smin pa med pa ni don dam @43a * //
analyzed: las dang rnam par smin pa med pa ni don dam @43a * //
translated: Karma and its result are not in the ultimate sense.

original: pa ste / de ltar kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis la brten nas las dang rnam par smin pa dang / las dang rnam par smin pa med pa dag gi de kho na shes pa de khong du chud pa'i phyir lnga par bzhed de /
analyzed: pa ste / de ltar kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis la brten nas las dang rnam par smin pa dang / las dang rnam par smin pa med pa dag gi de kho na shes pa de khong du chud pa'i phyir lnga par bzhed de /
translated: Thus, based on the two truths, conventional and ultimate, the knowledge of the reality of karma and its result, and of the absence of karma and its result, is accepted as the fifth, because of understanding.

original: ka zhes bya ba'i don khong du chud ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ka zhes bya ba'i don khong du chud ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of the syllable ka is understanding.

original: las dang rnam par smin pa med pa smos pa yang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i kun rdzob kyi bden pa la brten nas gsungs te /
analyzed: las dang rnam par smin pa med pa smos pa yang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i kun rdzob kyi bden pa la brten nas gsungs te /
translated: The statement about the absence of karma and its result is based on the supramundane conventional truth.

original: yang dag par na dgag par bya ba med pas //
analyzed: yang dag par na dgag par bya ba med pas //
translated: In reality, there is nothing to be refuted.

original: dgag pa mi 'jug pa'i phyir de ni med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: dgag pa mi 'jug pa'i phyir de ni med pa kho na'o //
translated: Because the negation does not apply, it is nonexistent.

original: yang na yang dag mi snang phyir //
analyzed: yang na yang dag mi snang phyir //
translated: Or, because they do not appear as real,

original: de gnyis ngo bo nyid med nyid //
analyzed: de gnyis ngo bo nyid med nyid //
translated: those two are just essenceless.

original: de ltar yang dag don shes pa //
analyzed: de ltar yang dag don shes pa //
translated: Thus, because of understanding the meaning of reality,

original: khong du chud phyir lnga par bzhed //
analyzed: khong du chud phyir lnga par bzhed //
translated: it is accepted as the fifth.

original: yang na gang gi phyir las dang rnam par smin pa dang las dang rnam par smin pa med pa gnyis yang dag par mi snang bas na /
analyzed: yang na gang gi phyir las dang rnam par smin pa dang las dang rnam par smin pa med pa gnyis yang dag par mi snang bas na /
translated: Or, because karma and its result and karma and its result do not appear as real,

original: ngo bo nyid med pa kho na yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa kho na yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: they are just essenceless.

original: ngo bo nyid med pa'o zhes de kho na nyid kyi don shes pa khong du chud pa'i phyir lnga par bzhed do //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa'o zhes de kho na nyid kyi don shes pa khong du chud pa'i phyir lnga par bzhed do //
translated: Thus, because of understanding the meaning of reality, it is accepted as the fifth.

original: de bstan pa ka zhes bya ba'i don khong du chud pa zhes bya ba dang sbyar te /
analyzed: de bstan pa ka zhes bya ba'i don khong du chud pa zhes bya ba dang sbyar te /
translated: It is said that the meaning of the word “ka” in the expression “ka-ka-ka-ka” is “understanding.”

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: las dang rnam par smin pa dang / las dang rnam par smin pa med pa la 'jug pa khong du chud pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: las dang rnam par smin pa dang / las dang rnam par smin pa med pa la 'jug pa khong du chud pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: It is said that it is the understanding of the engagement of karma and its result and of karma and its result.

original: gzungs kyi chos kyi rnam grangs kyis //
analyzed: gzungs kyi chos kyi rnam grangs kyis //
translated: By the dhāraṇī of the Dharma

original: stong pa nyid la sogs pa yi //
analyzed: stong pa nyid la sogs pa yi //
translated: The dhāraṇī of the Dharma element🔽is the knowledge that the emptiness of the dhāraṇī

original: chos kyi dbyings ni 'di shes pa //🔽rtogs phyir drug pa 'dir bzhed do //🔽chos kyi dbyings 'di ni gzungs kyi chos kyi rnam grangs kyi stong pa nyid la sogs pa gang dag yin pa de dag gi yin no snyam du shes pa gang yin pa de khong du chud pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings ni 'di shes pa // rtogs phyir drug pa 'dir bzhed do // chos kyi dbyings 'di ni gzungs kyi chos kyi rnam grangs kyi stong pa nyid la sogs pa gang dag yin pa de dag gi yin no snyam du shes pa gang yin pa de khong du chud pa'i phyir /
translated: is the Dharma element.🔽The sixth is accepted because of the understanding that this is the Dharma element of the emptiness of the dhāraṇī of the Dharma element, which is the emptiness of the dhāraṇī of the Dharma element and so on.

original: drug par bzhed de /
analyzed: drug par bzhed de /
translated: The sixth is accepted because of the understanding that this is the Dharma element of the emptiness of the dhāraṇī of the Dharma element and so on.

original: dha zhes bya ba'i don khong du chud ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽stong pa nyid la sogs pa yang /
analyzed: dha zhes bya ba'i don khong du chud ces bya ba'i tha tshig go // stong pa nyid la sogs pa yang /
translated: The meaning of the syllable dha is “understanding.”

original: yang dag par dpyad na dgag par bya ba med pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid stong pa kho na'o //
analyzed: yang dag par dpyad na dgag par bya ba med pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid stong pa kho na'o //
translated: Moreover, when emptiness and so on are properly analyzed, they are empty by nature because there is nothing to be refuted.

original: yang na gzungs chos rnams grangs kyis //
analyzed: yang na gzungs chos rnams grangs kyis //
translated: Alternatively, the dhāraṇī of the Dharma element

original: stong pa nyid la sogs pa nyid //
analyzed: stong pa nyid la sogs pa nyid //
translated: is the emptiness of the dhāraṇī of the Dharma element and so on.

original: chos dbyings yin par rnam shes pa //
analyzed: chos dbyings yin par rnam shes pa //
translated: The knowledge that this is the Dharma element

original: khong du chud phyir drug par bzhed //
analyzed: khong du chud phyir drug par bzhed //
translated: is the understanding of the sixth.

original: yang na gzungs kyi chos kyi rnam grangs kyi stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa gang yin pa de nyid chos kyi dbyings yin par shes pa gang yin pa de khong du chud pa'i phyir drug par bzhed do //
analyzed: yang na gzungs kyi chos kyi rnam grangs kyi stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa gang yin pa de nyid chos kyi dbyings yin par shes pa gang yin pa de khong du chud pa'i phyir drug par bzhed do //
translated: Or else, the sixth is accepted because of the understanding that the emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness of the dhāraṇī dharmas are the dharma-dhātu.

original: stong pa nyid la sogs pa yang ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa kho na yin mod kyi /
analyzed: stong pa nyid la sogs pa yang ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa kho na yin mod kyi /
translated: Emptiness and so on are indeed empty of intrinsic reality.

original: 'on kyang ngo bo @43b nyid la sogs pa la rnam par rtog pa spangs pa'i thabs bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on kyang ngo bo @43b nyid la sogs pa la rnam par rtog pa spangs pa'i thabs bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Nevertheless, in order to teach the method for abandoning conceptualization of intrinsic reality and so on,

original: yang dag pa'i kun rdzob la brten nas chos kyi dbyings zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i kun rdzob la brten nas chos kyi dbyings zhes gsungs so //
translated: the dharma-dhātu is taught in dependence on the correct relative.🔽The method for abandoning

original: ngo bo nyid sogs rnam rtog pa //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid sogs rnam rtog pa //
translated: conceptualization of intrinsic reality and so on

original: spangs pa'i thabs ni gdul rnams la //
analyzed: spangs pa'i thabs ni gdul rnams la //
translated: is taught to disciples

original: bstan par bya phyir mgon rnams kyis //🔽stong nyid la sogs bstan pa mdzad //
analyzed: bstan par bya phyir mgon rnams kyis // stong nyid la sogs bstan pa mdzad //
translated: in order to teach them.

original: rnam par rtog pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Conceptualization is of three types:

original: ngo bo nyid la rnam par rtog pa dang / mtshan ma la rnam par rtog pa dang / smon pa la rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid la rnam par rtog pa dang / mtshan ma la rnam par rtog pa dang / smon pa la rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: conceptualization of essence, conceptualization of signs, and conceptualization of wishes.

original: de la ngo bo nyid la rnam par rtog pa ni gzhan gnyis kyi sngon du 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: de la ngo bo nyid la rnam par rtog pa ni gzhan gnyis kyi sngon du 'gro ba'o //
translated: Among them, conceptualization of essence is the forerunner of the other two.

original: mtshan ma la rnam par rtog pa ni smon pa la rnam par rtog pa'i sngon du 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma la rnam par rtog pa ni smon pa la rnam par rtog pa'i sngon du 'gro ba ste /
translated: Conceptualization of signs is the forerunner of conceptualization of wishes.

original: de ltar 'di ni de'i gnyen po de dag gi go rims bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar 'di ni de'i gnyen po de dag gi go rims bstan pa yin te /
translated: Thus, this is the teaching of the order of their antidotes.

original: de bstan pa /
analyzed: de bstan pa /
translated: The teaching of that is:

original: dha zhes bya ba'i don du khong du chud pa zhes pa dang sbyar te /
analyzed: dha zhes bya ba'i don du khong du chud pa zhes pa dang sbyar te /
translated: Understand it as the meaning of the syllable dha.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: gzungs kyi chos kyis rnam grangs kyi //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gzungs kyi chos kyis rnam grangs kyi // zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa'o //
translated: It is said: By the dharani of the Dharma categories...

original: zhi gnas la sogs nyid yin zhes //
analyzed: zhi gnas la sogs nyid yin zhes //
translated: It is said: It is just calm abiding and so forth...

original: chos rnams thams cad mdor sdud de //
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad mdor sdud de //
translated: It is said: All phenomena are summarized...

original: de dag de bzhin nyid shes pa //🔽khong du chud phyir bdun par bzhed //
analyzed: de dag de bzhin nyid shes pa // khong du chud phyir bdun par bzhed //
translated: It is said: Understanding that suchness...

original: zhi gnas ni ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: zhi gnas ni ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: It is said: Calm abiding is meditative concentration...

original: sogs pa smos pas ni lhag mthong la sogs pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni lhag mthong la sogs pa bsdu'o //
translated: The phrase “and so on” includes insight and so on.

original: lhag mthong ni shes rab ste /
analyzed: lhag mthong ni shes rab ste /
translated: Insight is wisdom.

original: chos thams cad ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dang / zhi gnas dang lhag mthong ma yin pa nyid dam de dang ldan pa nyid do //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dang / zhi gnas dang lhag mthong ma yin pa nyid dam de dang ldan pa nyid do //
translated: All dharmas are either calm abiding and insight, or they are not calm abiding and insight, or they possess calm abiding and insight.🔽The suchness of those is the suchness of calm abiding and insight, because they are originally unborn.🔽Because a negation does not occur if there is nothing to be negated,🔽calm abiding and insight are also like that.

original: de dag gi de bzhin nyid ni re zhig zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dag gi de bzhin nyid yin te gzod ma nas ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi de bzhin nyid ni re zhig zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dag gi de bzhin nyid yin te gzod ma nas ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The suchness of those is the suchness of calm abiding and insight, because they are originally unborn.

original: dgag par bya ba med na dgag pa mi 'jug pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dgag par bya ba med na dgag pa mi 'jug pa'i phyir /
translated: Because a negation does not occur if there is nothing to be negated,

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong ma yin pa dag kyang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong ma yin pa dag kyang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: calm abiding and insight are also like that.🔽The one who knows that suchness is accepted as the seventh,

original: de bzhin nyid de shes pa gang yin pa khong du chud pa'i phyir bdun par bzhed de /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid de shes pa gang yin pa khong du chud pa'i phyir bdun par bzhed de /
translated: because he has penetrated the meaning of “flesh.”

original: sha zhes bya ba'i don khong du chud ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sha zhes bya ba'i don khong du chud ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of “flesh” is the meaning of “penetrated.”

original: de bstan pa /
analyzed: de bstan pa /
translated: That is taught.

original: sha zhes bya ba'i don khong du chud pa zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: sha zhes bya ba'i don khong du chud pa zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: The meaning of “flesh” is the meaning of “penetrated.”

original: ji lta bu'i tshul du zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu'i tshul du zhe na /
translated: In what way?

original: zhi gnas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: zhi gnas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa'o //
translated: The line The so-called calm abiding and so on is stated.

original: kun rdzob tu ni chos rnams kun //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni chos rnams kun //
translated: All phenomena are conventional.

original: skad cig gang yin de dag ni //🔽gzod nas zhi phyir don dam du //
analyzed: skad cig gang yin de dag ni // gzod nas zhi phyir don dam du //
translated: Those that are momentary

original: zad med la sogs bye brag bstan //
analyzed: zad med la sogs bye brag bstan //
translated: are ultimately free from exhaustion and so on.

original: ji ltar grags pa'i skad cig pa'i chos gang dag yin pa de dag rim pas dpyad na skad cig ma'i mi rtag pa'i phyir zad pa med pa'o //🔽rgyun gyi mi rtag pa @44a * //
analyzed: ji ltar grags pa'i skad cig pa'i chos gang dag yin pa de dag rim pas dpyad na skad cig ma'i mi rtag pa'i phyir zad pa med pa'o // rgyun gyi mi rtag pa @44a * //
translated: Those phenomena that are momentary as they are commonly known are, when analyzed in stages, free from exhaustion because they are momentary and impermanent.

original: med pa'i phyir 'jig pa med pa'o //
analyzed: med pa'i phyir 'jig pa med pa'o //
translated: They are free from destruction because they are impermanent in terms of a continuum.

original: rgyud kyi mi rtag pa med pa'i phyir rgyu ba med pa ste /
analyzed: rgyud kyi mi rtag pa med pa'i phyir rgyu ba med pa ste /
translated: They are free from movement because they are impermanent in terms of a stream.

original: gang dag la 'gro ba med pa de dag ni rgyu ba med pa'o //
analyzed: gang dag la 'gro ba med pa de dag ni rgyu ba med pa'o //
translated: Those that do not go are free from movement.

original: 'dir rgyun ni tshe gcig gi rgyun no //
analyzed: 'dir rgyun ni tshe gcig gi rgyun no //
translated: Here a continuum is the continuum of one lifetime.

original: rgyud ni tshe du ma'i yin par bzhed do //🔽ci'i phyir de dag rig pas dpyad na /
analyzed: rgyud ni tshe du ma'i yin par bzhed do // ci'i phyir de dag rig pas dpyad na /
translated: A stream is asserted to be [the continuum of] many lifetimes.

original: zad pa med pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo yin zhe na /
analyzed: zad pa med pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo yin zhe na /
translated: Why, when they are analyzed by the wise, are they the nature of being free from exhaustion and so on?

original: gzod ma nas zhi ba'i phyir zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: gzod ma nas zhi ba'i phyir zhes gsungs te /
translated: It is said, Because they are primordially peaceful.

original: chos thams cad skye ba med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: chos thams cad skye ba med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is: because all dharmas are non-arisen.

original: skye ba ni 'jig pa'i thog mar 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: skye ba ni 'jig pa'i thog mar 'byung ba ste /
translated: Arising is the beginning of destruction,

original: de sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it precedes that.

original: yang na gzod ma nas zhi ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid kyis zhi ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go//
analyzed: yang na gzod ma nas zhi ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid kyis zhi ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go//
translated: Or, the meaning is: because they are primordially peaceful, i.e., because they are peaceful by nature.

original: gzod ma ni ngo bo nyid la bya ste /
analyzed: gzod ma ni ngo bo nyid la bya ste /
translated: The beginning is taken to be the nature,

original: 'jig pa'i thog mar de 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i thog mar de 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it precedes the beginning of destruction.

original: ci'i phyir de dag zad pa med pa la sogs pa bye brag gis bstan zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de dag zad pa med pa la sogs pa bye brag gis bstan zhe na /
translated: Why are they taught with the distinctions of being inexhaustible, etc.?🔽It is said:

original: smras pa / mngon zhen rnam gsum spang ba'i phyir //
analyzed: smras pa / mngon zhen rnam gsum spang ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to abandon the three kinds of clinging,

original: zad med la sogs bye brag gam //
analyzed: zad med la sogs bye brag gam //
translated: they are taught with the distinctions of being inexhaustible, etc.,🔽or else,

original: yang na khams kyi bye brag gis //
analyzed: yang na khams kyi bye brag gis //
translated: with the distinctions of the realms,

original: rnam pa gsum du gsungs pa yin //
analyzed: rnam pa gsum du gsungs pa yin //
translated: they are said to be threefold.

original: mi rtag pa la sogs pa la gdul ba'i skye bo'i mngon par zhen pa rnam pa gsum yod de /
analyzed: mi rtag pa la sogs pa la gdul ba'i skye bo'i mngon par zhen pa rnam pa gsum yod de /
translated: There are three kinds of clinging of disciples to impermanence, etc.,

original: skad cig pa'i mi rtag pa la mngon par zhen pa dang / dus gzhan gyi gnas skabs kyi mi rtag pa la mngon par zhen pa dang / 'khor ba ji srid du gnas pa mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong du 'jug pa la mngon par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: skad cig pa'i mi rtag pa la mngon par zhen pa dang / dus gzhan gyi gnas skabs kyi mi rtag pa la mngon par zhen pa dang / 'khor ba ji srid du gnas pa mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong du 'jug pa la mngon par zhen pa'o //
translated: Attachment to the impermanence of momentary things, attachment to the impermanence of things in other times, and attachment to the entry into the city of nirvana of things that endure as long as cyclic life itself.

original: yang na khams gsum gyi bye brag la brten nas /
analyzed: yang na khams gsum gyi bye brag la brten nas /
translated: Or else, based on the distinctions of the three realms,

original: zad pa med pa la sogs pa'i bye brag go rims bzhin bstan te /
analyzed: zad pa med pa la sogs pa'i bye brag go rims bzhin bstan te /
translated: the distinctions of non-exhaustion, etc. are taught in order.

original: khams gsum pa la ma gtogs pa 'khor ba pa'i dngos po gzhan med la /
analyzed: khams gsum pa la ma gtogs pa 'khor ba pa'i dngos po gzhan med la /
translated: There is no other thing in cyclic life apart from the three realms,

original: de yang tshul de lta bu yin pas de'i phyir de la mngon par zhen pa spong pa'i phyir zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang tshul de lta bu yin pas de'i phyir de la mngon par zhen pa spong pa'i phyir zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and since that is the case, in order to abandon attachment to it, it is taught.

original: yang na gang gi phyir skad cig pa'i chos thams cad la brtags na /
analyzed: yang na gang gi phyir skad cig pa'i chos thams cad la brtags na /
translated: Or else, when all momentary things are investigated,

original: skad cig pa'i mi rtag pa med pa'i phyir zad pa med la /
analyzed: skad cig pa'i mi rtag pa med pa'i phyir zad pa med la /
translated: since there is no impermanence of momentary things, there is no exhaustion.

original: rgyun gyi mi rtag pa med pa'i phyir 'jig pa de'i phyir rgyu ba med de nyon mongs pa med ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rgyun gyi mi rtag pa med pa'i phyir 'jig pa de'i phyir rgyu ba med de nyon mongs pa med ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because there is no destruction, there is no movement, i.e., no defilement, because there is no impermanence of the stream.

original: de lta bu dag la nyon mongs pa rnams kyis gnas mi thong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta bu dag la nyon mongs pa rnams kyis gnas mi thong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the defilements do not remain in such a state.

original: zad pa med pa la sogs pa de dag nyid ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: zad pa med pa la sogs pa de dag nyid ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why are they inexhaustible, etc.?

original: gzod ma nas zhi ba'i phyir zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gzod ma nas zhi ba'i phyir zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Because they are calm from the beginning.

original: chos kun mya ngan 'das pa gang //
analyzed: chos kun mya ngan 'das pa gang //
translated: Nirvana of all things

original: de 'dir de bzhin nyid du bstan //
analyzed: de 'dir de bzhin nyid du bstan //
translated: is taught here as thusness.

original: 'dir chos thams cad mi snang bar 'gyur ba'i tshul gyis mya ngan las 'das pa na /
analyzed: 'dir chos thams cad mi snang bar 'gyur ba'i tshul gyis mya ngan las 'das pa na /
translated: Here, nirvana is the non-appearance of all things.

original: @44b chos thams cad mya ngan las 'das pa ni /
analyzed: @44b chos thams cad mya ngan las 'das pa ni /
translated: The nirvana of all things

original: 'dir de bzhin nyid yin par gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dir de bzhin nyid yin par gsungs so //
translated: is taught here as thusness.

original: de la 'jug pa rtogs pa ste //
analyzed: de la 'jug pa rtogs pa ste //
translated: The entry into that is realization.

analyzed: de rtogs phyir na brgyad par bzhed //

translated: The second shows the four benefits of the four comprehensions in their proper order.

original: yang na don khong du chud pa re re phan yon bzhi dang / rigs pa bzhi smos pa yin te /
analyzed: yang na don khong du chud pa re re phan yon bzhi dang / rigs pa bzhi smos pa yin te /
translated: Or else, each comprehension is stated with its four benefits and its four reasons.

original: byang chub dang nye ba la byang chub ni bla na med pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub dang nye ba la byang chub ni bla na med pa'o //
translated: In the phrase “near to enlightenment,” enlightenment is unexcelled.

original: shes rab rgya che ba la rgya che ba ni rnam pa gsum gyis bstan te /
analyzed: shes rab rgya che ba la rgya che ba ni rnam pa gsum gyis bstan te /
translated: The vastness of wisdom is shown by three kinds of vastness.

original: yul las ni yul mtha' dag la khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul las ni yul mtha' dag la khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Vastness of object, because it pervades all objects.

original: 'bras bu las ni bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa rgya chen po'i 'bras bu dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu las ni bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa rgya chen po'i 'bras bu dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: As for the result, it is endowed with the result of the great abundance of benefit for oneself and others.

original: ngo bo nyid las ni shes rab kyi yon tan ma lus pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid las ni shes rab kyi yon tan ma lus pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: As for its nature, it is endowed with all the qualities of wisdom.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad mngon sum du mthong ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rjes su slob par 'dod pas so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad mngon sum du mthong ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rjes su slob par 'dod pas so //
translated: One should practice it with great effort, because it is the cause of seeing all the buddhas face to face and of training in the path of all the buddhas.

original: rigs pa rnam pa bzhi ji ltar smos she na /
analyzed: rigs pa rnam pa bzhi ji ltar smos she na /
translated: Why are the four kinds of reason mentioned?

original: 'di ltar don de dag ni byang chub dang nye ba'i rgyu yin pa dang / shes rab rgya chen po'i rgyu yin pa dang / sangs rgyas thams cad mngon sum du mthong ba'i rgyu yin pa dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rjes su slob pa'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar don de dag ni byang chub dang nye ba'i rgyu yin pa dang / shes rab rgya chen po'i rgyu yin pa dang / sangs rgyas thams cad mngon sum du mthong ba'i rgyu yin pa dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rjes su slob pa'i rgyu yin te /
translated: Because these topics are the cause of approaching enlightenment, the cause of the vastness of wisdom, the cause of seeing all the buddhas face to face, and the cause of training in the path of all the buddhas.

original: 'di lta bu gang yin pa de dag ni /
analyzed: 'di lta bu gang yin pa de dag ni /
translated: Those who are like this

original: nges par nan tan du bsgrub par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: nges par nan tan du bsgrub par bya ba yin te /
translated: should practice with great effort.

original: dper na sbyin pa la sogs pa lta bu yin la /
analyzed: dper na sbyin pa la sogs pa lta bu yin la /
translated: For example, it is like generosity and so forth.

original: de dang 'dra bar don rnam pa bzhi po ji skad bstan pa 'di dag kyang de lta bu yin no //
analyzed: de dang 'dra bar don rnam pa bzhi po ji skad bstan pa 'di dag kyang de lta bu yin no //
translated: In the same way, these four topics that have been taught are like that.

original: da ni gzungs kyi ngo bo 'thob par bya ba'i thabs la gnas pa'i phan yon bstan te /
analyzed: da ni gzungs kyi ngo bo 'thob par bya ba'i thabs la gnas pa'i phan yon bstan te /
translated: Now, the benefits of abiding in the means of attaining the essence of dhāraṇī are taught.🔽The yogin who strives

original: bzhi tshan gsum gyis gzungs la ni //🔽mngon par brtson pa'i rnal 'byor pas //🔽thob bya ma thob par du yang //
analyzed: bzhi tshan gsum gyis gzungs la ni // mngon par brtson pa'i rnal 'byor pas // thob bya ma thob par du yang //
translated: in the dhāraṇī of the three sets of four🔽obtains four benefits

original: phan yon rnam pa bzhi 'thob 'gyur //
analyzed: phan yon rnam pa bzhi 'thob 'gyur //
translated: until attaining what is to be attained.

original: bzhi tshan @46b gsum gyis bstan pa'i thabs gang yin pa de la ni bzhi tshan gsum zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bzhi tshan @46b gsum gyis bstan pa'i thabs gang yin pa de la ni bzhi tshan gsum zhes bya ste /
translated: The means that are taught in the three sets of four are called the three sets of four.

original: bzhi tshan gsum bstan pa'i thabs des gzungs la mngon par brtson pa'i rnal 'byor pas /
analyzed: bzhi tshan gsum bstan pa'i thabs des gzungs la mngon par brtson pa'i rnal 'byor pas /
translated: By that means of teaching the three sets of four, the yogin who strives in the dhāraṇī

original: thob par bya ba ma thob ste //
analyzed: thob par bya ba ma thob ste //
translated: has not attained what is to be attained.

original: gzungs ma thob pa'i bar skabs su phan yon rnam pa bzhir 'gyur ba la /
analyzed: gzungs ma thob pa'i bar skabs su phan yon rnam pa bzhir 'gyur ba la /
translated: In the interval of not attaining the dhāraṇī, there are four benefits.

original: phyogs bcu na bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyis dgongs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: phyogs bcu na bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyis dgongs par 'gyur te /
translated: All the buddhas dwelling in the ten directions will think of him.

original: dgongs pa yang mkhyen pa tsam du ni ma zad do //
analyzed: dgongs pa yang mkhyen pa tsam du ni ma zad do //
translated: And the intention is not merely knowledge.

original: gal te mkhyen pa tsam du zad na ni phan yon du ma yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: gal te mkhyen pa tsam du zad na ni phan yon du ma yang mi rung ste /
translated: If it were merely knowledge, the benefits would not be appropriate,

original: mtshams med pa lnga byed pa yang thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshams med pa lnga byed pa yang thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because even one who has committed the five actions of immediate retribution would be regarded by the Omniscient One.

original: de bas na dgongs pa ni phan gdags par bzhed pa'i phyir gzigs pa la bya ste /
analyzed: de bas na dgongs pa ni phan gdags par bzhed pa'i phyir gzigs pa la bya ste /
translated: Therefore, the intention is to be understood as seeing, because it is the will to help.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi don bsgrub nus par nye bar bsgrub pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi don bsgrub nus par nye bar bsgrub pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Its characteristic is the ability to accomplish the aims of self and other.

original: de yang phan pa 'thob nus par nye bar bsgrub pa dang / gnod pa sbong nus par nye bar bsgrub pa dang / rnam pa gnyis su shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang phan pa 'thob nus par nye bar bsgrub pa dang / gnod pa sbong nus par nye bar bsgrub pa dang / rnam pa gnyis su shes par bya'o //
translated: And that is to be understood as twofold: the ability to obtain benefit and the ability to remove harm.

original: bdud kyi las med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bdud kyi las med par 'gyur te /
translated: The work of Mara is absent.

original: bdud ni nyon mongs pa'i bdud dang / lha'i bu'i bdud dang / rnam pa gnyis so //🔽de'i las ni phan ba dang / gnod pa /
analyzed: bdud ni nyon mongs pa'i bdud dang / lha'i bu'i bdud dang / rnam pa gnyis so // de'i las ni phan ba dang / gnod pa /
translated: Mara is twofold: the Mara of the defilements and the Mara of the son of gods.

original: 'thob par bya ba dang / spang bar bya ba la bar chad byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'thob par bya ba dang / spang bar bya ba la bar chad byed pa'o //
translated: His work is to create obstacles to obtaining benefit and removing harm.

original: de la snga ma med pa ni gzungs 'thob par bya ba'i thabs bsgoms pas nyon mongs pa'i bdud rnam par bsal ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de la snga ma med pa ni gzungs 'thob par bya ba'i thabs bsgoms pas nyon mongs pa'i bdud rnam par bsal ba'i phyir te /
translated: The first is not present because the method of cultivating the dhāraṇī eliminates the māra of the afflictions.

original: de nyid kyi phyir phyi ma shos kyang med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir phyi ma shos kyang med par 'gyur ro //
translated: For that very reason, the latter is also absent.

original: las kyi sgrib pa myur du 'byang ba ste /
analyzed: las kyi sgrib pa myur du 'byang ba ste /
translated: The karma-hindrance is quickly purified.

original: las kyi sgrib pa ni mtshams med pa lnga la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: las kyi sgrib pa ni mtshams med pa lnga la sogs pa ste /
translated: The karma-hindrance is the five heinous actions and so on.

original: de gzungs la sogs pa skye ba la sgrib pa'i phyir na sgrib pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de gzungs la sogs pa skye ba la sgrib pa'i phyir na sgrib pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called a hindrance because it obstructs the arising of the dhāraṇī and so on.

original: de yang rnam pa bzhis yongs su zad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa bzhis yongs su zad par 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, it is completely exhausted by four types:

original: rnam par sun 'byin pa kun spyod pa dang / gnyen po kun du spyod pa dang / sor chud par byed pa'i stobs dang / rten gyi stobs te /
analyzed: rnam par sun 'byin pa kun spyod pa dang / gnyen po kun du spyod pa dang / sor chud par byed pa'i stobs dang / rten gyi stobs te /
translated: the practice of thorough repudiation, the practice of the antidote, the power of restoration, and the power of support.

original: de skad du chos bzhi pa'i mdo las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de skad du chos bzhi pa'i mdo las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is stated in the Sūtra on the Four Qualities.

original: de la rnam par sun 'byin pa kun du spyod pas ni las kyi sgrib pa de mjug 'joms par byed do //
analyzed: de la rnam par sun 'byin pa kun du spyod pas ni las kyi sgrib pa de mjug 'joms par byed do //
translated: Among those, the practice of thorough repudiation destroys the end of that karma-hindrance.

original: gnyen po kun du spyod pas ni de rnam par smin par byed pa'i mthu nyams smad par byed do //
analyzed: gnyen po kun du spyod pas ni de rnam par smin par byed pa'i mthu nyams smad par byed do //
translated: By the practice of the antidote, one weakens the power of its maturation.

original: sor chud par byed pa'i stobs kyis ni de rnam par smin par byed pa'i mthu sel bar byed do //
analyzed: sor chud par byed pa'i stobs kyis ni de rnam par smin par byed pa'i mthu sel bar byed do //
translated: By the power of restoration, one removes the power of its maturation.

original: rten gyi stobs kyis ni sngar byung ba ni rgyang sring bar byed la /
analyzed: rten gyi stobs kyis ni sngar byung ba ni rgyang sring bar byed la /
translated: By the power of the basis, one extends the past and

original: sngar ma byung ba ni mi skye bar byed do //🔽'di @47a * //
analyzed: sngar ma byung ba ni mi skye bar byed do // 'di @47a * //
translated: prevents the future from arising.

original: ltar rten gyi stobs ni dge ba'i gshes gnyen la brten pa dang / chos kyi de kho na la spyod pa ste /
analyzed: ltar rten gyi stobs ni dge ba'i gshes gnyen la brten pa dang / chos kyi de kho na la spyod pa ste /
translated: Thus, the power of the basis is the support of spiritual benefactors and the practice of the reality of the Dharma.

original: de lta bas na rnam pa de dag gis las kyi sgrib pa byas shing bsags pa yang ma lus par 'byang bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na rnam pa de dag gis las kyi sgrib pa byas shing bsags pa yang ma lus par 'byang bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni rigs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable to say that by these aspects, the obscuration of karma, once created and accumulated, is completely purified.

original: gzungs thob par bya ba'i thabs bstan pa ni rnam par sun 'byin pa kun du spyod pa la sogs pa de dag nges par bstan te /
analyzed: gzungs thob par bya ba'i thabs bstan pa ni rnam par sun 'byin pa kun du spyod pa la sogs pa de dag nges par bstan te /
translated: The method of attaining retention is taught by the above explanation of the practice of remorse and so on.

original: 'di lta bus las kyi sgrib pa de dag ma lus par 'byang bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di lta bus las kyi sgrib pa de dag ma lus par 'byang bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because in this way, all those karmic obscurations are completely purified.

original: 'di ltar 'grib pa dang 'phel ba can gang yin pa de ni /🔽mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis zil gyis mnan pa 'phel na /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'grib pa dang 'phel ba can gang yin pa de ni / mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis zil gyis mnan pa 'phel na /
translated: Thus, that which has decrease and increase🔽is a dharma that, when its opposing side is overcome and it increases,

original: 'grib par 'gyur ba'i chos can yin te /
analyzed: 'grib par 'gyur ba'i chos can yin te /
translated: decreases.

original: dper na me 'bar ba la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na me 'bar ba la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the increase and decrease of a blazing fire.

original: de bzhin du las kyi sgrib pa yang 'grib pa ngang 'phel ba can yin no //🔽chud za bar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du las kyi sgrib pa yang 'grib pa ngang 'phel ba can yin no // chud za bar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: In the same way, karmic obscurations have decrease and increase.

original: gnyen po bsgom pa med pa la bya bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gnyen po bsgom pa med pa la bya bar shes par bya'o //
translated: What was said about “not being destroyed” and so on should be understood to refer to the absence of the cultivation of the antidote.

original: de lta ma yin na ni rigs pa dang 'gal ba dang / mdo sde mang po dag dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ni rigs pa dang 'gal ba dang / mdo sde mang po dag dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would contradict reasoning and contradict many sūtras.

original: nges pa zhes bya ba'i tshig kyang de nyid kyis bstan to //
analyzed: nges pa zhes bya ba'i tshig kyang de nyid kyis bstan to //
translated: The word “certainty” is also taught by that.

original: ma nges pa ni gnyen po bsgom pa med bzhin du yang ji sten 'bras bur mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma nges pa ni gnyen po bsgom pa med bzhin du yang ji sten 'bras bur mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The uncertain is not a result, even though one does not cultivate the antidote.

original: spobs pa rgyun mi 'chad pa yang 'thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: spobs pa rgyun mi 'chad pa yang 'thob par 'gyur te /
translated: One also obtains uninterrupted eloquence.

original: spobs pa rgyun mi 'chad pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: spobs pa rgyun mi 'chad pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Uninterrupted eloquence is twofold:

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis zil gyis mi non pa dang / gong nas gong du spobs pa'i mthu dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis zil gyis mi non pa dang / gong nas gong du spobs pa'i mthu dang ldan pa'o //
translated: unconquerable by adversaries and endowed with the power of eloquence in ever higher [stages].

original: gang gi phyir sangs rgyas thams cad kyis dgongs pa de'i phyir bdud kyi las med do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sangs rgyas thams cad kyis dgongs pa de'i phyir bdud kyi las med do //
translated: Because one is contemplated by all Buddhas, there is no work of Mara.

original: bdud kyi las las ring bar gyur na las kyi sgrib pa bde blag tu 'byang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdud kyi las las ring bar gyur na las kyi sgrib pa bde blag tu 'byang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When one is far from the work of Mara, the obscuration of karma is easily purified.

original: las kyi sgrib pa byang na spobs pa rgyun mi 'chad pa thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: las kyi sgrib pa byang na spobs pa rgyun mi 'chad pa thob par 'gyur te /
translated: When the obscuration of karma is purified, one obtains uninterrupted eloquence.

original: 'di ni phan yon gyi rim pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni phan yon gyi rim pa yin no //
translated: This is the sequence of benefits.

original: don de yang tshigs su bcad pas gsungs te /
analyzed: don de yang tshigs su bcad pas gsungs te /
translated: That meaning is also stated in verse:

original: ci'i phyir bzlas te gsungs she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bzlas te gsungs she na /
translated: Why is it repeated?

original: nges par gzung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: nges par gzung ba'i phyir te /
translated: For the sake of certainty.

original: des ni 'di bstan te /
analyzed: des ni 'di bstan te /
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: gzungs la mngon par brtson pa thams cad kyi phan yon 'di dag nges pa kho na 'thob pa la bya'i /
analyzed: gzungs la mngon par brtson pa thams cad kyi phan yon 'di dag nges pa kho na 'thob pa la bya'i /
translated: The benefits are definitely obtained by all those who strive for retention.

original: kha cig la srid pa tsam gyi phyir phan yon du bstan pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: kha cig la srid pa tsam gyi phyir phan yon du bstan pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not taught that the benefits are obtained by those who are only capable of a little.

original: yang na gang dag phan yon ston pa'i tshe ni ma 'dus la /
analyzed: yang na gang dag phan yon ston pa'i tshe ni ma 'dus la /
translated: Or else, when the benefits were taught, some were not present.

original: phyis lhags pa de dag gi ched du phan yon de tshigs su bcad pas brda sprad par mdzad de /
analyzed: phyis lhags pa de dag gi ched du phan yon de tshigs su bcad pas brda sprad par mdzad de /
translated: For their sake, the benefits are indicated by verse.

original: tshig dang @47b yi ge'i 'bru de dag nyid kyis brda sprad du zin na /
analyzed: tshig dang @47b yi ge'i 'bru de dag nyid kyis brda sprad du zin na /
translated: If they were indicated by those very words and syllables,

analyzed: gdul ba snga ma rnams 'phyar bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: the earlier disciples would be disturbed.

original: yang na bdag nyid kyis so so yang dag par rig pa'i che ba nyid bstan pa'i phyir yang tshigs su bcad de phan yon gsungs so //
analyzed: yang na bdag nyid kyis so so yang dag par rig pa'i che ba nyid bstan pa'i phyir yang tshigs su bcad de phan yon gsungs so //
translated: Or else, the benefits are stated in verse in order to demonstrate the greatness of one's own correct understanding.

original: yang na 'thad pa bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yang na 'thad pa bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: Or else, in order to demonstrate the logic.

original: 'di ltar spobs pa mtha' yas kyang thob par 'gyur zhes bya ba de'i 'thad pa ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar spobs pa mtha' yas kyang thob par 'gyur zhes bya ba de'i 'thad pa ni /
translated: For example, the logic of the statement, one will attain infinite eloquence, is as follows.

original: de'i las kyi sgrib pa myur du 'byang zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i las kyi sgrib pa myur du 'byang zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The meaning of “his karmic obscurations are quickly purified” is that he is purified of the obscurations to absorption.

original: de'i 'thad pa ni /
analyzed: de'i 'thad pa ni /
translated: The rationale for that is:

analyzed: de la bdud kyis glags ni rnyed mi 'gyur // zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: “Māra will not find an opportunity in him.”🔽The meaning of “Māra will not find an opportunity in him” is that he is purified of the obscurations to knowledge.

original: de'i 'thad pa ni /
analyzed: de'i 'thad pa ni /
translated: The rationale for that is:

analyzed: de ni sangs rgyas kun gyis yid la mdzad // ces bya ba yin no //
translated: “He is remembered by all the buddhas.”🔽The meaning of “he is remembered by all the buddhas” is that he is purified of the obscurations to buddha qualities.

original: de'i 'thad pa ni /
analyzed: de'i 'thad pa ni /
translated: The rationale for that is:

analyzed: gzungs 'di la mngon par brtson pa zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: “He is diligent in this dhāraṇī.”

analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar gzungs la mngon par brtson pa de'i phan yon ni /
translated: Therefore, the benefit of being diligent in this dhāraṇī is

analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas kun gyis yid la mdzad // ces bya ba 'di kho na yin no //
translated: “he is remembered by all the buddhas.”

original: gzhan ni brgyud par shes par bya'o //🔽mtha' yas pa ni zad pa med pa'am /
analyzed: gzhan ni brgyud par shes par bya'o // mtha' yas pa ni zad pa med pa'am /
translated: The other benefits should be understood in terms of their indirect effects.

original: yon tan mtha' yas pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yon tan mtha' yas pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Infinite” means inexhaustible or possessing infinite qualities.🔽Now, the past events are to be explained.

original: da ni sngon byung ba bsnyad pa brjod par bya ste /🔽sngon byung ba ni mdor bsdu na //
analyzed: da ni sngon byung ba bsnyad pa brjod par bya ste / sngon byung ba ni mdor bsdu na //
translated: The past events are taught

original: rnam pa dgur ni bstan par mdzad //
analyzed: rnam pa dgur ni bstan par mdzad //
translated: in nine topics in brief.

original: de yang so sor dbye ba ni //
analyzed: de yang so sor dbye ba ni //
translated: The individual divisions are

analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i dngos po la nges pa bskyed pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to generate certainty in the thing to be accomplished,
