analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis sngon byung ba bsnyad pa rnam pa dgu'i rim gyis ston par mdzad de /
translated: the Bhagavān teaches by way of the ninefold sequence of the past events.

original: dgu gang zhe na /🔽'di lta ste ston pa po bstan pa ni /
analyzed: dgu gang zhe na / 'di lta ste ston pa po bstan pa ni /
translated: What are the nine?🔽They are as follows:

original: ston pa de 'dra ba las na /
analyzed: ston pa de 'dra ba las na /
translated: The teaching of the teacher is taught🔽in order to show that from such a teacher

original: gdon mi za bar 'bras bu de lta bu thob par 'gyur ro zhes the tshom mi bya bar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gdon mi za bar 'bras bu de lta bu thob par 'gyur ro zhes the tshom mi bya bar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: one will certainly obtain such a result.

original: gzungs thob pa po'i rigs bstan pa dang / thob pa po bstan pa dang / thos nas thob par bya ba'i phyir mngon par brtson pa bstan pa dang / thob pa bstan pa dang / thob pa'i 'bras bu bstan pa ste /
analyzed: gzungs thob pa po'i rigs bstan pa dang / thob pa po bstan pa dang / thos nas thob par bya ba'i phyir mngon par brtson pa bstan pa dang / thob pa bstan pa dang / thob pa'i 'bras bu bstan pa ste /
translated: The teaching of the lineage of the one who obtains the dhāraṇī, the teaching of the one who obtains it, the teaching of the one who strives to obtain it after hearing it, the teaching of the obtainment, and the teaching of the result of obtainment.

original: 'di lta bu'i rigs su skyes la /
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i rigs su skyes la /
translated: One who is born into such a lineage

original: na tshod 'di tsam gyis brtson 'grus 'di lta bu byas te 'bras bu 'di lta bu thob nas /
analyzed: na tshod 'di tsam gyis brtson 'grus 'di lta bu byas te 'bras bu 'di lta bu thob nas /
translated: at this age, having made such effort, obtains such a result.

original: gzhan la phan pa 'di lta bu byed na /
analyzed: gzhan la phan pa 'di lta bu byed na /
translated: If one acts in this way to benefit others,🔽why should we not do the same?

original: bdag cag gis kyang 'di lta bu ci'i phyir mi bya snyam du brtson 'grus chung ba rnams spro ba bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag cag gis kyang 'di lta bu ci'i phyir mi bya snyam du brtson 'grus chung ba rnams spro ba bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to generate enthusiasm in those of little perseverance.

original: rjes su yi rang byed pa bstan pa ni rjes su yi rang ba tsam gyis kyang 'bras bu de lta bu 'thob na /
analyzed: rjes su yi rang byed pa bstan pa ni rjes su yi rang ba tsam gyis kyang 'bras bu de lta bu 'thob na /
translated: The teaching on rejoicing is as follows: If one attains such a result merely through rejoicing,🔽why would one not attain it through earnestly practicing the conduct as taught?

original: ji skad bstan pa'i spyod pa la nan tan du sgrub pas lta ci'i phyir thob par mi 'gyur snyam du nges pa bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa'i spyod pa la nan tan du sgrub pas lta ci'i phyir thob par mi 'gyur snyam du nges pa bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to generate certainty in this way.

original: de ji ltar @48a * //🔽mngon snyam pa'i the tshom bsal ba'i phyir rjes su yi rang ba'i 'bras bu bstan pa dang / bdag dang gzhan dag las dpe blangs nas /
analyzed: de ji ltar @48a * // mngon snyam pa'i the tshom bsal ba'i phyir rjes su yi rang ba'i 'bras bu bstan pa dang / bdag dang gzhan dag las dpe blangs nas /
translated: In order to dispel the doubt of How is that?

original: rjes su yi rang ba'i 'bras bu brda sprad pa ste /
analyzed: rjes su yi rang ba'i 'bras bu brda sprad pa ste /
translated: the result of rejoicing is taught, and the result of rejoicing is indicated by taking oneself and others as examples.

original: 'di ni mdor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mdor bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the brief teaching.

original: 'di ltar sngon byung ba bsnyad pa de so sor dbye na ni rnam pa du mar dbye ba yod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar sngon byung ba bsnyad pa de so sor dbye na ni rnam pa du mar dbye ba yod do //
translated: If this previously told story is analyzed, it has many aspects.

original: gang gi phyir ston pa po yang /
analyzed: gang gi phyir ston pa po yang /
translated: Because the teacher

original: dus dang mtshan dang yon tan dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa rnam pa bzhir bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus dang mtshan dang yon tan dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa rnam pa bzhir bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: is taught to have four kinds of transcendence of sorrow.

original: de la dus ni sngon zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan te /
analyzed: de la dus ni sngon zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan te /
translated: Therein, transcendence of time is taught by the words “in the past” and so on.

original: chags bral slob dang mi slob dang // bse ru la sogs rgyal ba'i sras //
analyzed: chags bral slob dang mi slob dang // bse ru la sogs rgyal ba'i sras //
translated: The disciples of the Victorious Ones, the rhinoceroses and so on,

original: de dag gis shes lam las 'das //
analyzed: de dag gis shes lam las 'das //
translated: have transcended the path of knowledge.

original: grangs med la sogs bstan pa yin //
analyzed: grangs med la sogs bstan pa yin //
translated: The immeasurable and so on are taught.

original: grangs med pa ni 'jig rten pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams kyi shes pa'i lam las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: grangs med pa ni 'jig rten pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams kyi shes pa'i lam las 'das pa'o //
translated: The immeasurable is the transcendence of the path of knowledge of those who are free from worldly attachment.

original: ches grangs med pa ni slob pa 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams kyi shes pa'i lam las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: ches grangs med pa ni slob pa 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams kyi shes pa'i lam las 'das pa'o //
translated: The very immeasurable is the transcendence of the path of knowledge of those who are free from attachment and are still in training.

original: yangs pa ni mi slob pa rnams kyi shes pa'i lam las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: yangs pa ni mi slob pa rnams kyi shes pa'i lam las 'das pa'o //
translated: The vast is the transcendence of the path of knowledge of those who are no longer in training.

original: rgya cher gyur pa ni bse ru la sogs pa'i shes pa'i lam las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: rgya cher gyur pa ni bse ru la sogs pa'i shes pa'i lam las 'das pa ste /
translated: The extensive is the transcendence of the path of knowledge of the rhinoceros-like and so on.

original: sogs pa smos pas ni /
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni /
translated: The word “and so on” in the root verse refers to🔽the transcendence of the path of knowledge of the bodhisattvas.

original: rang sangs rgyas tshogs dang spyod pa rnams bsdu'o //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas tshogs dang spyod pa rnams bsdu'o //
translated: The Pratyekabuddhas are included in the group of the “solitary” ones, and in the group of the “practitioners”.

original: tshad med pa las ni bde bar gshegs pa'i sras rnams kyi shes pa'i lam las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: tshad med pa las ni bde bar gshegs pa'i sras rnams kyi shes pa'i lam las 'das pa'o //
translated: The “infinite” ones are the sons of the Sugata, who are beyond the path of knowledge.🔽Or else,🔽The path of the Bodhisattvas is taught to be infinite, etc., because of the absence of the following:

original: yang na / gzhal bya'i dngos po bye brag dag / go byed grangs dang bstod gzhal dang // kun nas gzhal dang tshad ces bya //🔽de dag med phyir de skad bstan //
analyzed: yang na / gzhal bya'i dngos po bye brag dag / go byed grangs dang bstod gzhal dang // kun nas gzhal dang tshad ces bya // de dag med phyir de skad bstan //
translated: enumeration, praise, evaluation, complete evaluation, and measure, which are the things to be evaluated.🔽The “infinite” ones are the sons of the Sugata, who are beyond the path of knowledge.🔽Or else,

original: grangs med pa la sogs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: grangs med pa la sogs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: The path of the Bodhisattvas is taught to be infinite, etc., because of the absence of the following:🔽enumeration, praise, evaluation, complete evaluation, and measure, which are the things to be evaluated.

original: grangs med pa ni yongs su gcod par byed pa'i grangs med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grangs med pa ni yongs su gcod par byed pa'i grangs med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Infinite” means that there is no enumeration which can delimit it.🔽“Immeasurable” means that it is beyond the sixty-four measures.

original: ches grangs med pa ni gnas drug cu par bab pa'i grangs la grangs med pa zhes bya ba yin par dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir grangs med pa'i bye brag smos par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: ches grangs med pa ni gnas drug cu par bab pa'i grangs la grangs med pa zhes bya ba yin par dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir grangs med pa'i bye brag smos par mdzad pa'o //
translated: “Incalculable” means that it is beyond the number which is reached by the sixty-fourth measure.

original: yangs pa smos pa ni bstod de gzhal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yangs pa smos pa ni bstod de gzhal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Vast” means that it is beyond praise.

original: kun nas gzhal ba ni kun tu gzhal ba yin pa'i phyir yongs su gzhal ba ste /🔽de med pa'i rgya che bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas gzhal ba ni kun tu gzhal ba yin pa'i phyir yongs su gzhal ba ste / de med pa'i rgya che bar gyur pa'o //
translated: It is completely measured because it is completely measured.

original: tshad med pa ni tshad med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad med pa ni tshad med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is immeasurable because it is immeasurable.

original: de ltar na de la yongs su gcod par byed pa thams cad med par bstan pa'i phyir ro //🔽snga ma snga ma sgrub pa yi //
analyzed: de ltar na de la yongs su gcod par byed pa thams cad med par bstan pa'i phyir ro // snga ma snga ma sgrub pa yi //
translated: Thus, in order to demonstrate that all determination is absent in it,

original: gtan tshigs phyi ma phyi ma yin //
analyzed: gtan tshigs phyi ma phyi ma yin //
translated: The reason for the former is the latter.

original: yang na grangs med pa la sogs pa snga ma snga ma bsgrub pa'i @48b gtan tshigs ni /
analyzed: yang na grangs med pa la sogs pa snga ma snga ma bsgrub pa'i @48b gtan tshigs ni /
translated: Or else, the reason for the former, i.e. the immeasurable, etc.

original: ches grangs med pa la sogs pa phyi ma phyi ma yin par shes par bya'o //🔽yang na la la sngar ma thos //
analyzed: ches grangs med pa la sogs pa phyi ma phyi ma yin par shes par bya'o // yang na la la sngar ma thos //
translated: is the latter, i.e. the very immeasurable, etc.

original: gang yang rung bas don de ston //🔽yang gdul bya kha cig snga ma bstan pa'i tshe /
analyzed: gang yang rung bas don de ston // yang gdul bya kha cig snga ma bstan pa'i tshe /
translated: Or else, for some, the meaning is taught by one who has not heard it before.🔽Or else, for some disciples, the meaning is taught by one who has not heard it before,

original: don de ma thos pa la phyis ches grangs med pa la sogs pa'i tshig gzhan gyis brda sprod par mdzad do//
analyzed: don de ma thos pa la phyis ches grangs med pa la sogs pa'i tshig gzhan gyis brda sprod par mdzad do//
translated: at the time of the former teaching, but later, by other words, i.e. the very immeasurable, etc.🔽the meaning is taught by one who has heard it before, at the time of the latter teaching.

original: mtshan ni rin chen dpal gyi gzi brjid rgyal po zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mtshan ni rin chen dpal gyi gzi brjid rgyal po zhes bya ba'o //
translated: His name was Ratnaśrītejorāja.

original: yon tan ni de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan te /
analyzed: yon tan ni de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan te /
translated: His qualities are indicated by the words “the Tathāgata” and so forth.

original: gdul bya'i don ni rab bsgrub phyir //
analyzed: gdul bya'i don ni rab bsgrub phyir //
translated: In order to accomplish the welfare of those to be trained,

original: ye shes spangs pa'i rang bzhin nyid //
analyzed: ye shes spangs pa'i rang bzhin nyid //
translated: he has the nature of abandoning wisdom.

original: ci 'dra de ni rgyu dang bcas //
analyzed: ci 'dra de ni rgyu dang bcas //
translated: What is he like? He has a cause.

original: phun sum tshogs gnyis bstod pa gsungs //
analyzed: phun sum tshogs gnyis bstod pa gsungs //
translated: He is praised as having the two perfections.

original: gdul ba bcom ldan 'das la mngon par ma dad pa rnams dad pa bskyed pa'i phyir dang / mngon par dad pa rnams dad pa 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gdul ba bcom ldan 'das la mngon par ma dad pa rnams dad pa bskyed pa'i phyir dang / mngon par dad pa rnams dad pa 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to generate faith in those to be trained who have no faith in the Bhagavān, and in order to increase the faith of those who have faith,

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa gnyis kyis bstod pa gsungs so //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa gnyis kyis bstod pa gsungs so //
translated: he is praised as having the two kinds of perfection, one’s own and others’.

original: rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa sngar smos pa ni de zhar las byung ba yin yang /
analyzed: rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa sngar smos pa ni de zhar las byung ba yin yang /
translated: Although the perfection of one’s own aim was mentioned earlier,

original: de cig shos kyi sngon du 'gro ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de cig shos kyi sngon du 'gro ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it is a byproduct of the other, and it precedes it.

original: de la ye shes dang spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa'i rgyu mtshon pa ni /
analyzed: de la ye shes dang spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa'i rgyu mtshon pa ni /
translated: The indication of the cause of the perfection of wisdom and abandonment is:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyis bstan te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyis bstan te /
translated: The Tathāgata himself has taught this.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas snga ma rnams lam gang nas gshegs pa nyid nas gshegs pas na de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas snga ma rnams lam gang nas gshegs pa nyid nas gshegs pas na de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: He is called the Tathāgata because he has come from the very path by which the former perfect buddhas came.

original: dgra rnams bcom pas na dgra bcom pa ste /
analyzed: dgra rnams bcom pas na dgra bcom pa ste /
translated: He is called the Arhat because he has destroyed the enemies.

original: 'dis ni spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: This shows his perfection of abandonment.

original: dgra dag ni 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa rnams te /
analyzed: dgra dag ni 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa rnams te /
translated: The enemies are the afflictions such as passion, etc.

original: dge ba'i chos thams cad la gnod pa byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos thams cad la gnod pa byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they injure all virtuous qualities.

original: spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa 'di sngar smos pa ni /
analyzed: spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa 'di sngar smos pa ni /
translated: This perfection of abandonment is mentioned first

original: de la ye shes phun sum tshogs pa'i sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la ye shes phun sum tshogs pa'i sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the antecedent of the perfection of knowledge.

original: yang dag pa phyin ci ma log par kun nas sangs rgyas pas na yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa phyin ci ma log par kun nas sangs rgyas pas na yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
translated: He is called the Perfectly Enlightened One because he is perfectly enlightened with regard to the real, i.e., non-erroneously.

original: 'dis ni ye shes phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
analyzed: 'dis ni ye shes phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
translated: This shows his perfection of knowledge.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes phyin ci ma log par bstan pa'i phyir ro //🔽gal te thub pa snga ma rnams lam gang nas gshegs pa'i lam de nas 'di yang gshegs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes phyin ci ma log par bstan pa'i phyir ro // gal te thub pa snga ma rnams lam gang nas gshegs pa'i lam de nas 'di yang gshegs pa'i phyir /
translated: because he teaches the unerring wisdom of omniscience.

original: de bzhin gshegs ba zhes bya na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs ba zhes bya na /
translated: If the former sages are called “thus-gone” because they went by the path on which he went,

original: lam de nyid gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: lam de nyid gang yin zhe na /
translated: then what is that very path?

original: rig pa dang zhabs su ldan pa ste /
analyzed: rig pa dang zhabs su ldan pa ste /
translated: It is the path of rightness and the path of feet.

original: 'dis ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa bstan te /
analyzed: 'dis ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa bstan te /
translated: This shows the eightfold noble path.

original: rig pa ni yang dag pa'i lta ba'o //🔽yang dag pa'i @49a * //
analyzed: rig pa ni yang dag pa'i lta ba'o // yang dag pa'i @49a * //
translated: Right view is rightness.

original: rtog pa la sogs pa yan lag bdun ni zhabs te /
analyzed: rtog pa la sogs pa yan lag bdun ni zhabs te /
translated: The seven limbs beginning with right thought are feet.

original: yang dag pa'i lta bas de kho na gzigs nas /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta bas de kho na gzigs nas /
translated: Having seen reality by means of right view,

original: yang dag pa'i rtog pa la sogs pa zhabs su gyur pa rnams kyis gshegs pa'i phyir ro //🔽yang na bslab pa gsum ni /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i rtog pa la sogs pa zhabs su gyur pa rnams kyis gshegs pa'i phyir ro // yang na bslab pa gsum ni /
translated: he went by means of the feet consisting of right thought, etc.

original: rig pa dang zhabs te /
analyzed: rig pa dang zhabs te /
translated: Or else, the three trainings are rightness and feet.

original: lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa ni rig pa'o //
analyzed: lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa ni rig pa'o //
translated: The training in higher wisdom is rightness.

original: lhag pa'i sems dang / lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa ni zhabs te /
analyzed: lhag pa'i sems dang / lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa ni zhabs te /
translated: The training in the higher mind and the training in the higher morality are the feet.

original: shes rab kyi sngon du yongs su spyod par gyur pa ni zhabs te spyod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyi sngon du yongs su spyod par gyur pa ni zhabs te spyod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The training in wisdom is the wings, because it is the practice that precedes the wings.

original: rig pa sngar smos pa ni de yongs su dag pas tshul khrims dang ting nge 'dzin yongs su dag par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rig pa sngar smos pa ni de yongs su dag pas tshul khrims dang ting nge 'dzin yongs su dag par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The knowledge is mentioned first, because morality and samadhi are purified by the purification of that knowledge.

original: yang na sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa shes pa mngon sum du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa dang / 'chi 'pho dang / skye ba shes pa mngon sum du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa dang / zag pa zad pa mngon sum du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa dang /
analyzed: yang na sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa shes pa mngon sum du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa dang / 'chi 'pho dang / skye ba shes pa mngon sum du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa dang / zag pa zad pa mngon sum du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa dang /
translated: Or else, the superknowledges are the knowledge of recollecting former abodes, the superknowledge of knowing the decease and rebirth of beings, and the superknowledge of knowing the destruction of the impurities.

original: 'di gsum ni rig pa'o //
analyzed: 'di gsum ni rig pa'o //
translated: These three are the knowledge.

original: zhabs ni tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa dang / spyod pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / bzlog pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / lhag pa'i sems las byung ba tshe 'di la bde bar gnas pa bzhi po rnams te /
analyzed: zhabs ni tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa dang / spyod pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / bzlog pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / lhag pa'i sems las byung ba tshe 'di la bde bar gnas pa bzhi po rnams te /
translated: The feet are the four perfect abodes of this life: perfect morality, perfect conduct, perfect restraint, and perfect mental abidings.

original: rig pa rnams kyi sngon du yongs su spyod par gyur pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rig pa rnams kyi sngon du yongs su spyod par gyur pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because they are the prior practice of the knowledges.

original: sngar spyad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar spyad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are the prior practice.

original: de la tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa ni rang bzhin dang bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba spangs shing ma nyams pa la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de la tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa ni rang bzhin dang bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba spangs shing ma nyams pa la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Among them, perfect morality is the possession of the virtues of abandoning natural and proscribed offenses, and of not letting them reoccur, etc.

original: spyod pa phun sum tshogs pa ni spyod lam thams cad shes bzhin du gnas pa'o //🔽bzlog pa phun sum tshogs pa ni mig la sogs pa'i yul rnams la mtshan mar mi 'dzin pas /
analyzed: spyod pa phun sum tshogs pa ni spyod lam thams cad shes bzhin du gnas pa'o // bzlog pa phun sum tshogs pa ni mig la sogs pa'i yul rnams la mtshan mar mi 'dzin pas /
translated: Perfect conduct is the abiding in all activities with full awareness.

original: dbang po bsdams pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po bsdams pa'o //
translated: Perfect restraint is the control of the senses, by not grasping the signs of the objects of the eyes, etc.🔽Perfect mental abidings are the four meditations.

original: de ltar tshul khrims yongs su dag pa dang / shes bzhin du gnas pa dang / dbang po rnams kyi sgo bsrung ba ni /🔽lhag pa'i sems las byung ba /
analyzed: de ltar tshul khrims yongs su dag pa dang / shes bzhin du gnas pa dang / dbang po rnams kyi sgo bsrung ba ni / lhag pa'i sems las byung ba /
translated: abiding with vigilance, and guarding the doors of the senses

original: tshe 'di la bde bar gnas pa bzhi sgrub par byed de /
analyzed: tshe 'di la bde bar gnas pa bzhi sgrub par byed de /
translated: are the four that accomplish the higher mind.

original: de dag ni bsam gtan bzhi po rnams so //
analyzed: de dag ni bsam gtan bzhi po rnams so //
translated: These are the four meditations.

original: de'i phyir 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das de ni rig pa rnams dang / zhabs 'di rnams dang ldan pas /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das de ni rig pa rnams dang / zhabs 'di rnams dang ldan pas /
translated: Therefore, the Blessed One, endowed with these knowledges and feet,

original: rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa brnyes par gyur pa'i phyir /🔽rig pa dang zhabs su ldan pa ni rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa 'thob pa'i rgyur bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa brnyes par gyur pa'i phyir / rig pa dang zhabs su ldan pa ni rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa 'thob pa'i rgyur bstan pa yin no //
translated: has attained the perfection of his own aim.🔽Thus, the perfection of his own aim is taught as the cause for attaining the perfection of his own aim.

original: rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa de ji lta bu yin pa de yang /
analyzed: rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa de ji lta bu yin pa de yang /
translated: The perfection of his own aim is of such a kind.

original: bde bar gshegs pa zhes bya @49b pas bstan te /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa zhes bya @49b pas bstan te /
translated: This is taught by the word “Sugata.”

original: 'di ltar 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam nas ye shes dang spangs pa phun sum tshogs par legs par gshegs pas na bde bar gshegs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam nas ye shes dang spangs pa phun sum tshogs par legs par gshegs pas na bde bar gshegs pa ste /
translated: He is the Well-Gone because he has gone well to the perfection of intuitive wisdom and abandonment by means of the supramundane path.

original: gzugs legs ba bzhin no //
analyzed: gzugs legs ba bzhin no //
translated: He is like a well-formed figure.

original: yang na phyir mi ldog par gshegs pas na bde bar gshegs pa ste /
analyzed: yang na phyir mi ldog par gshegs pas na bde bar gshegs pa ste /
translated: Or, he is the Well-Gone because he has gone irreversibly.

original: rims nang legs par sos pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rims nang legs par sos pa bzhin no //
translated: He is like one who is well-recovered from a fever.

original: ma lus par gshegs pa'i phyir yang bde bar gshegs pa ste /
analyzed: ma lus par gshegs pa'i phyir yang bde bar gshegs pa ste /
translated: He is the Well-Gone because he has gone everywhere.

original: bum pa shin tu gang ba bzhin no //
analyzed: bum pa shin tu gang ba bzhin no //
translated: He is like a completely full vase.

original: don 'di gsum yang phyi rol pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / slob pa dang / mi slob pa rnams las rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa bye brag tu bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don 'di gsum yang phyi rol pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / slob pa dang / mi slob pa rnams las rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa bye brag tu bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: These three meanings are taught in order to distinguish his perfection of his own aim from that of the non-Buddhist ascetics, the trainees, and the non-trainees.

original: 'jig rten mkhyen pa ni skal pa dang ldan pa dang / skal ba dang ldan pa ma yin par mkhyen pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten mkhyen pa ni skal pa dang ldan pa dang / skal ba dang ldan pa ma yin par mkhyen pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is the Knower of the World because he knows who is and who is not a fit vessel.

original: 'dis ni gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i rgyu bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i rgyu bstan to //
translated: This teaches the cause of his perfection of the aims of others.

original: skal ba dang ldan pa dang / skal ba dang ldan pa ma yin pa thugs su chud nas /
analyzed: skal ba dang ldan pa dang / skal ba dang ldan pa ma yin pa thugs su chud nas /
translated: Having understood who is fortunate and who is not,

original: skal ba dang ldan pa rnams 'dul bar mdzad pas na /
analyzed: skal ba dang ldan pa rnams 'dul bar mdzad pas na /
translated: he disciplines those who are fortunate.

original: skyes bu gdul ba'i kha lo sgyur ba bla na med pa zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: skyes bu gdul ba'i kha lo sgyur ba bla na med pa zhes gsungs te /
translated: Thus he is the unsurpassed trainer of those who can be trained.

original: 'dis ni gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: This shows his perfection of altruism.

original: gdul bar 'os pa dang / gdul bar nus pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gdul bar 'os pa dang / gdul bar nus pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: He is a trainer because he is worthy of being trained and because he is able to train.

original: gdul ba ste skyes bu nyid gdul ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gdul ba ste skyes bu nyid gdul ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is a trainer because he is a person who is to be trained.

original: skyes bu gdul ba'o //
analyzed: skyes bu gdul ba'o //
translated: He is a trainer of persons.

original: de dag gis kha lo sgyur ba ni lam ngan pa nas bzlog ste lam bzang por 'dzud pa'i phyir dang / yon tan gyi khyad par bskyed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de dag gis kha lo sgyur ba ni lam ngan pa nas bzlog ste lam bzang por 'dzud pa'i phyir dang / yon tan gyi khyad par bskyed pa'i phyir te /
translated: He is a trainer because he turns them away from the wrong path and sets them on the right path and because he causes them to develop special qualities.

original: rta la sogs pa'i kha lo sgyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: rta la sogs pa'i kha lo sgyur ba bzhin no //
translated: He is like a trainer of horses, etc.

original: bla na med pa smos pa ni /
analyzed: bla na med pa smos pa ni /
translated: The word unsurpassed shows that

original: gdul dka' ba /
analyzed: gdul dka' ba /
translated: he is difficult to surpass.

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / nga rgyal shas che ba 'phags pa mdzes dga' dang / sor phreng dang / lteng rgyas 'od srungs dang / rgyal po chen po ka pi na la sogs pa gdul ba yang yin no zhes bstan pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / nga rgyal shas che ba 'phags pa mdzes dga' dang / sor phreng dang / lteng rgyas 'od srungs dang / rgyal po chen po ka pi na la sogs pa gdul ba yang yin no zhes bstan pa'i don to //
translated: He is also the subduer of those who are predominantly attached, such as Nanda; those who are predominantly hateful, such as Aṅgulimāla; those who are predominantly deluded, such as Subhadra; and those who are predominantly proud, such as Mahāmaudgalyāyana, Kāśyapa, and King Kapina.

original: lha dang mi rnams kyi ston pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa ji lta bu yin pa bstan to //
analyzed: lha dang mi rnams kyi ston pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa ji lta bu yin pa bstan to //
translated: The phrase “the teacher of gods and humans” indicates the perfection of his work for others.

original: ston pa'i phyir ni ston pa ste /
analyzed: ston pa'i phyir ni ston pa ste /
translated: He is a teacher because he teaches.

original: bstan pa na 'phags pa'i bden ba bzhi khong du chud pa'o //
analyzed: bstan pa na 'phags pa'i bden ba bzhi khong du chud pa'o //
translated: When he teaches, he causes the four noble truths to be understood.

original: de bas na lha dang mi smos te /
analyzed: de bas na lha dang mi smos te /
translated: Therefore, he is said to be the teacher of gods and humans,

original: de dag kho na khong du chud pa'i skal pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag kho na khong du chud pa'i skal pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because only they are capable of understanding.

original: lam bzang po ston pa la sogs pa'i rgyu nyid kyis ni thams cad kyi yang ston pa yin te /
analyzed: lam bzang po ston pa la sogs pa'i rgyu nyid kyis ni thams cad kyi yang ston pa yin te /
translated: He is the teacher of all because he is the cause of teaching the good path and so forth.

original: de'i phyir sems can thams cad kyi ston pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir sems can thams cad kyi ston pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, he is said to be the teacher of all sentient beings.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa rtogs pa des zhugs na /🔽theg pa ji lta ba bzhin du @50a * //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa rtogs pa des zhugs na / theg pa ji lta ba bzhin du @50a * //
translated: If one enters into the realization of the noble truths,

original: ye shes dang spangs pa phun sum tshogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ye shes dang spangs pa phun sum tshogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: one will attain the perfection of wisdom and abandonment in accordance with the vehicle.

original: ye shes dang spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ye shes dang spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom and abandonment is called the perfection of the benefit of others.

original: de ltar na bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa de su yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa de su yin zhe na /
translated: If one has the perfection of one’s own and others’ benefit, who is it?

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rin chen dpal gyi gzi brjid rgyal po lta bu zhes bya ba zhes gsungs pa dang sbyar te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rin chen dpal gyi gzi brjid rgyal po lta bu zhes bya ba zhes gsungs pa dang sbyar te /
translated: It is the Bhagavat Buddha, the Jewel Glory King of Splendor.

original: blo khyad par du 'phags pa 'di la yod pas na sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: blo khyad par du 'phags pa 'di la yod pas na sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
translated: He is called Buddha because he has this special wisdom.

original: blo khyad par du 'phags pa yang rnam pa dgu ste /
analyzed: blo khyad par du 'phags pa yang rnam pa dgu ste /
translated: This special wisdom is ninefold.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa dang / bsgrim mi dgos par mkhyen pa dang / lung phog pa med par mkhyen pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa bag chags dang bcas pa spangs pa dang / rnam pa thams cad du sems can thams cad kyi don mdzad par spyod pa dang /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa dang / bsgrim mi dgos par mkhyen pa dang / lung phog pa med par mkhyen pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa bag chags dang bcas pa spangs pa dang / rnam pa thams cad du sems can thams cad kyi don mdzad par spyod pa dang /
translated: omniscience, knowledge of all aspects, effortless knowledge, knowledge without verbal instruction, abandonment of afflictive obstructions and obstructions to omniscience together with their propensities, and activity that benefits all sentient beings in all ways.

original: thugs rjes phun sum tshogs pa dang / zad mi shes pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / mtshungs pa med pa phun sum tshogs pas so //
analyzed: thugs rjes phun sum tshogs pa dang / zad mi shes pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / mtshungs pa med pa phun sum tshogs pas so //
translated: It is also due to the perfection of compassion, the perfection of inexhaustibility, and the perfection of sameness.

original: yang na dngos po thams cad rnam pa thams cad du thugs su chud pa'i phyir sangs rgyas zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yang na dngos po thams cad rnam pa thams cad du thugs su chud pa'i phyir sangs rgyas zhes bya ste /
translated: Or, it is called buddha because it comprehends all things in all ways.

original: da ltar gyi dus la bya'o //🔽ma 'ongs pa yang de de'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ltar gyi dus la bya'o // ma 'ongs pa yang de de'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir /
translated: It is the present.

original: sangs rgyas zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhes bya ste /
translated: The future is also called buddha because it is the nature of that.

original: 'o ma dang bud shing bzhin no //
analyzed: 'o ma dang bud shing bzhin no //
translated: It is like milk and fuel.

original: gal te de ltar na 'das pa na sangs rgyas ma yin par 'gyur ro zhe na mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na 'das pa na sangs rgyas ma yin par 'gyur ro zhe na mi 'gyur te /
translated: If that is so, then the Buddha would not have been a Buddha in the past.

original: sangs rgyas 'das pa ni med pas yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa ni mi srid par bstan zin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'das pa ni med pas yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa ni mi srid par bstan zin te /
translated: But that is not so, because it has already been explained that the Buddha does not exist in the past, and that it is impossible for him to enter parinirvana.

original: 'khor ba ji srid yod kyi bar du skad cig re re la dngos po'i yul ma lus pa la mkhyen pa 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khor ba ji srid yod kyi bar du skad cig re re la dngos po'i yul ma lus pa la mkhyen pa 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because as long as samsara exists, his knowledge penetrates all things in every moment.

original: yang na rnam pa thams cad du lhag pa med pa'i yon tan thams cad dang ldan pa de la ni sangs rgyas zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yang na rnam pa thams cad du lhag pa med pa'i yon tan thams cad dang ldan pa de la ni sangs rgyas zhes bya ste /
translated: Or else, the one who possesses all the qualities without exception is called a Buddha.

original: de'i phyir 'di la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di la nyes pa med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no fault in this.

original: yang na ston pa po bcom ldan 'das la dad pa'i khyad par bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na ston pa po bcom ldan 'das la dad pa'i khyad par bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or else, it is in order to generate the special faith in the Teacher, the Bhagavat.

analyzed: stong pa nyid phun sum tshogs pa yon tan gyi che ba nyid bstan te / ston pa rnam gnyis gang gis 'thob //
translated: The greatness of the qualities of perfect emptiness is taught.🔽By what means are the two teachers attained?

original: ci 'dra de yi lam rnam gnyis //
analyzed: ci 'dra de yi lam rnam gnyis //
translated: What are the two paths of that one?

original: gang dag la ni de gnas dang // de dang ldan pa'ang ston par byed //
analyzed: gang dag la ni de gnas dang // de dang ldan pa'ang ston par byed //
translated: He shows the one who is established in it and the one who possesses it.

original: de la ston pa nyid phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa gnyis ni /
analyzed: de la ston pa nyid phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa gnyis ni /
translated: The perfection of teaching is twofold:

analyzed: gsungs pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid dang / bsgrub pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: the perfection of teaching as such and the perfection of practice as such.

original: de la gsungs pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid ni /
analyzed: de la gsungs pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid ni /
translated: The perfection of teaching as such is

original: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes gsungs pa yin te chos rnams ji ltar gnas @50b pa de kho na bzhin du gsungs pas na de bzhin gsungs pa zhes bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes gsungs pa yin te chos rnams ji ltar gnas @50b pa de kho na bzhin du gsungs pas na de bzhin gsungs pa zhes bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: the one who is called the Tathagata, because he teaches just as it is, since he teaches things just as they are.

original: 'dis ni phyin ci ma log par chos ston pa po nyid yin par bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni phyin ci ma log par chos ston pa po nyid yin par bstan to //
translated: This shows that he is the one who teaches the Dharma without error.

original: sgrub pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid ni /
analyzed: sgrub pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid ni /
translated: The perfection of practice as such is

analyzed: spangs pa dang ye shes phun sum tshogs pa'i ngo bo nyid rnam pa gnyis te go rims bzhin du dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: the perfection of abandonment and the perfection of knowledge, which are the two natures, respectively, of the one who is called the Arhat and the one who is called the Perfectly Enlightened Buddha.

original: de'i phyir de ltar phyin ci ma log par chos ston pa po nyid dang / nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa dang / rnam pa thams cad du chos thams cad thugs su chud pas bcom ldan 'das kyis ston pa nyid phun sum tshogs pa thun mong ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar phyin ci ma log par chos ston pa po nyid dang / nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa dang / rnam pa thams cad du chos thams cad thugs su chud pas bcom ldan 'das kyis ston pa nyid phun sum tshogs pa thun mong ma yin pa dang /
translated: Therefore, the Teacher, the Blessed One, is endowed with the perfection of teaching, because he teaches the Dharma unerringly, he is endowed with the perfection of relinquishment, because he has relinquished all afflictions and he is endowed with the perfection of realization, because he has realized all aspects of all phenomena.🔽

original: yongs su rdzogs par bstan te /
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs par bstan te /
translated: Therefore, the Blessed One’s teaching is shown to be unerring, to be the relinquishment of all the afflictions, and to be the full comprehension of all aspects of all things, and thus his teaching is shown to be perfect and unique.

analyzed: 'di ltar phyi rol pa rnams la phyin ci ma log par chos ston pa po nyid med de /

analyzed: rnam pa thams cad kyi ston pa ma yin no //
translated: because they have not fully comprehended all things in all aspects.

analyzed: ston pa nyid phun sum tshogs pa de gang gis 'thob pa de ni rig pa dang zhabs su ldan pa zhes bya bas bstan to //

analyzed: ston pa nyid phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa gnyis pa de ci 'dra ba de yang /

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyis bstan pa tshangs par nges pa med de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyis bstan pa tshangs par nges pa med de /
translated: The teaching of all the Buddhas is not uncertain,

original: 'di las chos ni nan tan du //
analyzed: 'di las chos ni nan tan du //
translated: because it is well-established in the Dharma.

original: legs bsgrub nyams su len par bstan /
analyzed: legs bsgrub nyams su len par bstan /
translated: The practice is taught as the accomplishment of the Dharma.

original: gsung rab 'di la las su byas pas stong pa nyid kyi chos yang dag par sgrub cing rtogs par bya ba dang / sbyin pa la sogs pa bsgrub pa 'di ni nyams su blang ba'o //🔽yang na 'dzin pa la sogs pa //
analyzed: gsung rab 'di la las su byas pas stong pa nyid kyi chos yang dag par sgrub cing rtogs par bya ba dang / sbyin pa la sogs pa bsgrub pa 'di ni nyams su blang ba'o // yang na 'dzin pa la sogs pa //
translated: The practice is the accomplishment of the Dharma of emptiness and the realization of it through the performance of action in this scripture, and the practice of generosity and so on.

original: yon tan skyed par 'gyur ba yin //🔽nyams su blang ba zhes bya ba snyegs te /
analyzed: yon tan skyed par 'gyur ba yin // nyams su blang ba zhes bya ba snyegs te /
translated: Or else, it is the generation of the qualities of retention and so on.

original: yang na 'dzin pa dang / sems pa dang / bsgom pa dang / gzhan la ston pa la sogs pa yon tan bskyed pa de phyin ci ma log pa'i phyir nyams su blang ba'o //
analyzed: yang na 'dzin pa dang / sems pa dang / bsgom pa dang / gzhan la ston pa la sogs pa yon tan bskyed pa de phyin ci ma log pa'i phyir nyams su blang ba'o //
translated: The generation of the qualities of retention, thought, realization, teaching others, and so on is the practice, because it is the non-erroneous practice.

original: yang na rjes su yi rang ba yang nyams su blang ba yin no //🔽sangs rgyas gzhan dag ma yin zhes //
analyzed: yang na rjes su yi rang ba yang nyams su blang ba yin no // sangs rgyas gzhan dag ma yin zhes //
translated: Or else, rejoicing is also a practice.

original: de yi mtshan ni smos pa mdzad //
analyzed: de yi mtshan ni smos pa mdzad //
translated: The mention of its name is for the purpose of showing that it is not the same as other Buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas bye ba phrag dgu bcu po gang yang rung ba las rang byung bar 'dzin pa bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bye ba phrag dgu bcu po gang yang rung ba las rang byung bar 'dzin pa bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to eliminate the notion that the Buddha is self-existent, he mentions the name of a particular Buddha.

original: rin chen dpal gyi gzi brjid rgyal po lta bu'i mtshan smos so //
analyzed: rin chen dpal gyi gzi brjid rgyal po lta bu'i mtshan smos so //
translated: For example, just as the king of splendor, Ratnaśrītejorāja,

original: mtshan smos pa /
analyzed: mtshan smos pa /
translated: The mention of the name

original: des na thub pa bzhugs pa ni //
analyzed: des na thub pa bzhugs pa ni //
translated: Therefore, the Sage remains

original: 'jig rten phan phyir nyid du bstan //
analyzed: 'jig rten phan phyir nyid du bstan //
translated: for the sake of the world's benefit.

original: 'di ltar yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i dus dpags pa las kyang /
analyzed: 'di ltar yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i dus dpags pa las kyang /
translated: Thus, the time of parinirvāṇa is also measured.

original: bcom ldan 'das de de srid kyi bar du bzhugs pa ni rgyal po'i bu de des gdul ba yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de de srid kyi bar du bzhugs pa ni rgyal po'i bu de des gdul ba yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The Blessed One remains for that long because the prince is to be guided by him.

original: de'i phyir 'di dag gis ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni 'jig rten la phan pa kho na'i phyir dus mtha' yas par yang bzhugs par mdzad do zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di dag gis ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni 'jig rten la phan pa kho na'i phyir dus mtha' yas par yang bzhugs par mdzad do zhes bstan to //
translated: Therefore, it is taught that the Blessed Buddhas remain for limitless time solely for the benefit of the world.🔽The Sage, through diligence, morality,

original: sdom brtson tshul khrims ldan pa dang // brtson dang gzhan don gzhol ba yis //
analyzed: sdom brtson tshul khrims ldan pa dang // brtson dang gzhan don gzhol ba yis //
translated: effort, and devotion to others' welfare,

original: gzungs ni thob par thub pa des //
analyzed: gzungs ni thob par thub pa des //
translated: attains the dhāraṇīs.

original: rab byung la sogs tshig gis bstan //
analyzed: rab byung la sogs tshig gis bstan //
translated: and the monkhood, etc.

original: yon tan thams cad kyi gzhi ni tshul khrims yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yon tan thams cad kyi gzhi ni tshul khrims yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The basis of all good qualities is morality.

original: tshul khrims dang ldan pas gzungs 'di 'thob par 'gyur gyi gzhan gyis ma yin par bcom ldan @53a * //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan pas gzungs 'di 'thob par 'gyur gyi gzhan gyis ma yin par bcom ldan @53a * //
translated: Therefore, the Blessed One taught the dhāraṇī as being for one who is moral, not for one who is immoral.

original: 'das kyis rab tu byung ba'i tshig gis bstan te /
analyzed: 'das kyis rab tu byung ba'i tshig gis bstan te /
translated: He taught it with the word “monkhood.”

original: 'di rnams kyis ni /
analyzed: 'di rnams kyis ni /
translated: By these,

original: thos nas thob par bya ba'i phyir mngon par brtson par bya ba bstan pa bsnyad do //
analyzed: thos nas thob par bya ba'i phyir mngon par brtson par bya ba bstan pa bsnyad do //
translated: he taught the explanation of the striving for the attainment of the dhāraṇī through hearing.

original: brtson 'grus brtsams pas gzungs 'di thob par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtsams pas gzungs 'di thob par 'gyur gyi /
translated: The dhāraṇī is attained by one who has undertaken striving,

original: gzhan gyis ma yin par ni lo dgu khri zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis ma yin par ni lo dgu khri zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan te /
translated: not by one who has not. This is taught by “for ninety thousand years,” etc.

original: 'dis ni 'thob pa bstan pa bsnyad do //🔽gzhan gyi don sgrub pa'i bsam pa can gyis /
analyzed: 'dis ni 'thob pa bstan pa bsnyad do // gzhan gyi don sgrub pa'i bsam pa can gyis /
translated: By this, he taught the explanation of the attainment of the dhāraṇī.

original: gzungs 'di 'thob par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gzungs 'di 'thob par 'gyur gyi /
translated: The dhāraṇī is attained by one who has the intention to accomplish the aims of others,

original: gzhan gyis ma yin par ni bsgrubs nas kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis ma yin par ni bsgrubs nas kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan te /
translated: not by one who does not. This is taught by “having accomplished,” etc.

original: 'dis ni thob pa'i 'bras bu bstan pa bsnyad de de kho na yin no zhes gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni thob pa'i 'bras bu bstan pa bsnyad de de kho na yin no zhes gzung bar bya'o //
translated: This is the teaching of the result of attainment. It should be understood that this is the reality.

original: de lta ma yin na ni rab tu byung ba la sogs pa bstan pa yang don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ni rab tu byung ba la sogs pa bstan pa yang don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, the teaching of renunciation, etc. would be meaningless.

original: de la thob pa'i 'bras bu bstan pa ni rnam pa gnyis kyis bshad de /
analyzed: de la thob pa'i 'bras bu bstan pa ni rnam pa gnyis kyis bshad de /
translated: There, the teaching of the result of attainment is explained in two ways:

original: yang dag par rab tu bstan pa dang / yang dag par rab tu bstan pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu bstan pa dang / yang dag par rab tu bstan pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: the correct teaching and the result of the correct teaching.

original: yang dag par rab tu bstan pa yang /
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu bstan pa yang /
translated: The correct teaching

original: yang dag par sbyin pa dang / rgyas pa dang / rang gi ngo bo dang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: yang dag par sbyin pa dang / rgyas pa dang / rang gi ngo bo dang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: is threefold: correct giving, correct expansion, and correct essence.

original: yang dag par sbyin pa ni sems can thams cad la'o //
analyzed: yang dag par sbyin pa ni sems can thams cad la'o //
translated: Correct giving is to all sentient beings.

original: de dag kyang gzungs yang dag par rab tu bstan pas 'dul ba kho na yin par gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: de dag kyang gzungs yang dag par rab tu bstan pas 'dul ba kho na yin par gzung bar bya ste /
translated: And they should be understood as only being disciplined by the correct teaching of the dhāraṇī.

original: thams cad kyi sgra ni brjod par 'dod bsam lus pa la bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad kyi sgra ni brjod par 'dod bsam lus pa la bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The word all refers to those who are intended to be included.

original: sems can thams cad kho na la bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kho na la bya ba ma yin te /
translated: It is not only to all sentient beings.

original: de dag la ni thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pas yang dag par rab tu bstan par bya mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag la ni thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pas yang dag par rab tu bstan par bya mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are not omniscient, they are not able to teach it correctly.

original: thams cad mkhyen pas de bstan du yang sems can thams cad yul du 'gyur mi srid de /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pas de bstan du yang sems can thams cad yul du 'gyur mi srid de /
translated: And it is not possible for an omniscient one to teach it to all sentient beings,

original: dgos pa med pa'i phyir mi rung ngo //
analyzed: dgos pa med pa'i phyir mi rung ngo //
translated: because it is not necessary.

original: rgyas pa zhes bya ba ni gzungs la sbyor ba dang / 'thob pa dang / 'bras bu dang / yon tan chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po'i bye brag la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo tshad ma dang ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyas pa zhes bya ba ni gzungs la sbyor ba dang / 'thob pa dang / 'bras bu dang / yon tan chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po'i bye brag la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo tshad ma dang ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: The extensive explanation is the essence of the dhāraṇī, which is endowed with valid cognition, the distinctions of application, attainment, result, small, middling, and great qualities, and so on.

original: yang dag par phyin ci ma log pa dang / pho brang 'khor gyi skad la sogs pa'i yon tan yan lag bcu dang ldan pa'i tshig gis rab tu dang / pha rol rnams zil gyis mnan nas bstan pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par phyin ci ma log pa dang / pho brang 'khor gyi skad la sogs pa'i yon tan yan lag bcu dang ldan pa'i tshig gis rab tu dang / pha rol rnams zil gyis mnan nas bstan pa'o //
translated: It is the teaching that is endowed with the ten qualities of speech, such as being correct, unmistaken, and in the language of the palace, and so on, that overwhelms others.

original: yang dag par rab tu bstan pa'i 'bras bu ni /
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu bstan pa'i 'bras bu ni /
translated: The result of the correct teaching

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la 'god pa ste /
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la 'god pa ste /
translated: is the establishment of the irreversible stage.

original: 'di ni shin tu khyad zhugs pa'i 'bras bur bstan to //
analyzed: 'di ni shin tu khyad zhugs pa'i 'bras bur bstan to //
translated: This is taught as the very special result.

original: lha dang / mir skye ba dang sa 'thob pa @53b la sogs pa'i 'bras bu gzhan ni ma smos kyang 'grub pa'i phyir ma bstan to //
analyzed: lha dang / mir skye ba dang sa 'thob pa @53b la sogs pa'i 'bras bu gzhan ni ma smos kyang 'grub pa'i phyir ma bstan to //
translated: Other results, such as birth as a god or human, attainment of the stages, and so on, are not mentioned, but are established.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog pa'i sa yang yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog pa'i sa yang yod pa'i phyir /
translated: The stage of irreversibility from the enlightenment of the śrāvakas and so on also exists.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub smos so //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub smos so //
translated: Therefore, “unsurpassed perfect complete enlightenment” is mentioned.🔽The stage of irreversibility from unsurpassed perfect complete enlightenment also exists.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la yang phyir mi ldog pa'i sa yod pa'i phyir phyir mi ldog pa smos te /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la yang phyir mi ldog pa'i sa yod pa'i phyir phyir mi ldog pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, “irreversible” is mentioned.

original: 'dis ni gzungs 'thob pa rgyun gyis 'brel pa'i don du bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni gzungs 'thob pa rgyun gyis 'brel pa'i don du bstan to //
translated: This teaches the meaning of the continuous connection of attaining the dhāraṇīs.

original: de'i phyir de'i 'og tu sh'a ri'i bu 'khor de na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i 'og tu sh'a ri'i bu 'khor de na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, after that, Śāriputra, in that assembly... and so on is stated.

original: gzungs thob pa rgyun gyis 'brel pas ni ji lta bur brtson par byed kyang rung ba gang dang gang yin pa de dang des ni /
analyzed: gzungs thob pa rgyun gyis 'brel pas ni ji lta bur brtson par byed kyang rung ba gang dang gang yin pa de dang des ni /
translated: By the continuous connection of attaining the dhāraṇīs, whatever one strives for, by that and that,

original: gzungs 'di nges pa kho nas 'thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzungs 'di nges pa kho nas 'thob par 'gyur te /
translated: This dhâraî is obtained by certainty alone.

original: la las ma thob pa gang yin pa de ni bdag nyid kyi nyes pa la sogs pa las gyur par bstan to //
analyzed: la las ma thob pa gang yin pa de ni bdag nyid kyi nyes pa la sogs pa las gyur par bstan to //
translated: Whatever is not obtained by some is taught to be due to one's own faults, etc.

original: rjes su yi rang bar byed pa bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rjes su yi rang bar byed pa bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching of rejoicing is as follows:

original: 'khor dang / 'brel pa dang / rigs dang / ming dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang / 'brel ba dang / rjes su yi rang ba'o //
analyzed: 'khor dang / 'brel pa dang / rigs dang / ming dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang / 'brel ba dang / rjes su yi rang ba'o //
translated: The retinue, the connection, the lineage, the name, the spiritual friend, the connection, and the rejoicing.

original: rjes su yi rang ba'i 'bras bu bstan pa dgu ste /
analyzed: rjes su yi rang ba'i 'bras bu bstan pa dgu ste /
translated: The teaching of the result of rejoicing is ninefold:

original: yang dag pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnyed pa dang / de las chos thos pa dang / de nyams su blangs pa dang / gzungs thob pa rnams kyi mchog dang / gzung ba'i tshig dang ldan pa rnams kyi mchog dang // spobs pa rgyun mi 'chad pa rnams kyi mchog dang /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnyed pa dang / de las chos thos pa dang / de nyams su blangs pa dang / gzungs thob pa rnams kyi mchog dang / gzung ba'i tshig dang ldan pa rnams kyi mchog dang // spobs pa rgyun mi 'chad pa rnams kyi mchog dang /
translated: The supreme attainment of the perfect spiritual friend, the hearing of the Dharma from him, the practice of it, the supreme attainment of the dhâraî, the supreme attainment of the words of the dhâraî, the supreme attainment of uninterrupted eloquence,

original: de dag mnyes par bya ba'i dus dang / mnyes par bya ba dang / bla na med pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
analyzed: de dag mnyes par bya ba'i dus dang / mnyes par bya ba dang / bla na med pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
translated: and they are pleased with him, and he attains supreme enlightenment.🔽The sutra on rejoicing is immediately after,

original: de la / mdo la zhes bya de ma thag / yang na cig car 'byung ba yin //
analyzed: de la / mdo la zhes bya de ma thag / yang na cig car 'byung ba yin //
translated: or it occurs simultaneously.🔽The sutra on rejoicing is immediately after,

original: rjes su yi rang ba'i mdo la zhes bya ba ni 'di la mdo la zhes bya ba'i sgra smos pa de ni 'dir de ma thag tu byung ba la bya ste /
analyzed: rjes su yi rang ba'i mdo la zhes bya ba ni 'di la mdo la zhes bya ba'i sgra smos pa de ni 'dir de ma thag tu byung ba la bya ste /
translated: the term sutra here refers to what immediately follows,

original: dper na byams pa'i mdo las skyes pa dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag sgom par byed do zhes bya ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na byams pa'i mdo las skyes pa dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag sgom par byed do zhes bya ba de bzhin du /
translated: just as in the sutra on love, it is said that one cultivates the mindfulness enlightenment factor that has arisen.

original: 'dir yang rjes su yi rang ma thag pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang rjes su yi rang ma thag pa'o //
translated: Similarly, here too, rejoicing is immediately after.

original: skyes pa ni thob ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: skyes pa ni thob ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Arisen means obtained.

original: yang na cig car 'byung ba la bya ste /
analyzed: yang na cig car 'byung ba la bya ste /
translated: Or it occurs simultaneously,

original: 'khor lo dang bcas par zung shig ces bya ba la sogs pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: 'khor lo dang bcas par zung shig ces bya ba la sogs pa de bzhin du /
translated: just as it is said to seize the wheel together with its axle.

original: rjes su yi rang ba'i mod las skyes pa ni thob ste /
analyzed: rjes su yi rang ba'i mod las skyes pa ni thob ste /
translated: Similarly, the rejoicing that has arisen is obtained.

original: byung zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: byung zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The word “thus” means “in this way.”

original: dgu bcu zhes bya la sogs tshig //
analyzed: dgu bcu zhes bya la sogs tshig //
translated: The words “ninety-one eons”

original: des ni dus gzhan dgongs @54a * //
analyzed: des ni dus gzhan dgongs @54a * //
translated: indicate that the Buddha had another time in mind.

original: pa yin // dgu bcu zhes bya ba'i tshig gang yin pa des ni dus gzhan la dgongs te gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: pa yin // dgu bcu zhes bya ba'i tshig gang yin pa des ni dus gzhan la dgongs te gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The word “ninety-one” indicates that the Buddha had another time in mind when he spoke of the result of the wholesome roots that arise from rejoicing.

original: rjes su yi rang ba'i mdo kho na las skyes pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba las de ma thag tu de lta bu'i 'bras bu thob pa ni ma yin te thal ches pa'i phyir ro //🔽phul phyin yon tan ldan pa yi//
analyzed: rjes su yi rang ba'i mdo kho na las skyes pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba las de ma thag tu de lta bu'i 'bras bu thob pa ni ma yin te thal ches pa'i phyir ro // phul phyin yon tan ldan pa yi//
translated: The result is not obtained immediately after the wholesome roots that arise from rejoicing, because that would be absurd.🔽The Buddha’s disciples are endowed with the perfection of the great, great perfection,

original: phul du phyin pa chen po'i yang chen po'i mtshan nyid kyis dang / gzungs thob pa dang 'brel pa'i yon tan gyis so //
analyzed: phul du phyin pa chen po'i yang chen po'i mtshan nyid kyis dang / gzungs thob pa dang 'brel pa'i yon tan gyis so //
translated: and with the qualities associated with the attainment of the dhāraṇīs.

original: yang na phul du phyin pa ma lus pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i sgo mtha' yas sgrub pa'i gzungs ni thob par gyur pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang na phul du phyin pa ma lus pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i sgo mtha' yas sgrub pa'i gzungs ni thob par gyur pa'i phyir /
translated: Or else, the dhāraṇī of the accomplishment of infinite doors, which is endowed with the characteristics of all the perfections without exception, has been attained.

original: de'i rgyus / bde bar gshegs pa'i sras po de //
analyzed: de'i rgyus / bde bar gshegs pa'i sras po de //
translated: As a result of that, the sons of the Sugata

original: sangs rgyas bye ba phrag dgu bcu po de dag gi 'khor du gang dag gzungs thob par gyur pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bye ba phrag dgu bcu po de dag gi 'khor du gang dag gzungs thob par gyur pa /
translated: He was the foremost of those who had attained the dhāraṇīs

original: gzungs thob rnams kyi mchog yin no //
analyzed: gzungs thob rnams kyi mchog yin no //
translated: among the retinue of those ninety million buddhas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de dag gi mchog yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de dag gi mchog yin no //
translated: He was the foremost of those bodhisattvas.🔽Because of his special wisdom

original: ye shes khyad 'phags 'brel ba dang // yon tan phul phyin ldan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: ye shes khyad 'phags 'brel ba dang // yon tan phul phyin ldan pa'i phyir //
translated: and his possession of the highest qualities,

original: de'i rgyus de dag gi 'khor du byang chub sems dpa'/
analyzed: de'i rgyus de dag gi 'khor du byang chub sems dpa'/
translated: the Victorious Ones have proclaimed him

original: de ni tshig gzungs ldan rnams kyi //
analyzed: de ni tshig gzungs ldan rnams kyi //
translated: as the foremost of those who possess the dhāraṇīs.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi nang na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi nang na /
translated: Among the bodhisattvas,

original: mchog tu rgyal ba rnams kyis bstan //
analyzed: mchog tu rgyal ba rnams kyis bstan //
translated: he is the supreme one, as taught by the Victorious Ones.

original: ye shes khyad par du 'phags pa ni /
analyzed: ye shes khyad par du 'phags pa ni /
translated: His special wisdom

original: sa dang / gzungs dang / ye shes la sogs pa phul du phyin pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: sa dang / gzungs dang / ye shes la sogs pa phul du phyin pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: is endowed with the highest perfection of the stages, dhāraṇīs, wisdom, and so forth.

original: yon tan ni mngon par shes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: yon tan ni mngon par shes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: His qualities are the superknowledges and so forth.

original: gang gis sems can rnams kyi rang bzhin dang / bsam pa dang / bag la nyal la sogs pa rtogs na /
analyzed: gang gis sems can rnams kyi rang bzhin dang / bsam pa dang / bag la nyal la sogs pa rtogs na /
translated: By means of them, he realizes the natures, thoughts, and propensities of sentient beings.

original: rdzu 'phrul la sogs pas 'dun par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul la sogs pas 'dun par byed pa'o //

analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la mi bya bar dgar ba'i phyir ro //

original: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par yang ma zad kyi /
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par yang ma zad kyi /

original: de'i phyir de ni phyis gsungs so //

original: dngos po stong pas 'dod mi bya //

original: mi mthun blo ni mi bskyed cing //
analyzed: mi mthun blo ni mi bskyed cing //
translated: One should not generate a mind that disagrees,

original: cis kyang the tshom mi bya'o //
analyzed: cis kyang the tshom mi bya'o //

original: tshong dpon gyi bu zla ba'i tog ces bya ba ni mar me mdzad las tha dad do snyam du som nyi 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid lta bu yang mi bya'o //
analyzed: tshong dpon gyi bu zla ba'i tog ces bya ba ni mar me mdzad las tha dad do snyam du som nyi 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid lta bu yang mi bya'o //
translated: You should not have any doubt, like the characteristic of desire, thinking that the merchant’s son Candraketu is different from Dīpaṃkara.

original: de ni dngos po stong pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de ni dngos po stong pa'i phyir te /
